title: Holocaust survivor leads Michigan vigil against US - backed Israeli genocide in Gaza
message:
Rene Lichtman, an 86-year-old Holocaust child survivor, led a vigil in the Detroit suburb of Farmington Hills Sunday afternoon to protest the US-backed Israeli genocide in Gaza.
The event, held outside the of the Zekelman Holocaust Museum, was sponsored by the Coalition Against Genocide.
Holocaust survivor Rene Lichtman, right, holds a sign while another demonstrator reads a statement, at a vigil against the ongoing genocide in Gaza, on June 30, 2024, in Farmington Hills, Michigan.

event_breakdown:
Antisemitism is on the rise in the United States, according to a new report from the Anti-Defamation League.

The report, which was released Tuesday, found that antisemitic incidents in the U.S. rose by 57 percent in 2017, the largest single-year increase on record.

The study also found that antisemitic incidents like harassment, vandalism, and assault were up by 10 percent last year.

The ADL has been tracking antisemitic incidents for decades, and this is the first time it has found an increase in such incidents since it began collecting data in 1979.

"We have seen a significant increase in antisemitic incidents in the United States," Anti-Defamation League CEO Jonathan Greenblatt said in a statement. "These incidents have been documented in community centers and on college campuses, in schools and online."
Antisemitism has been on the rise in Europe, too, with a recent survey showing that more than one-third of European Jews experienced some form of harassment or violence in 2017.

This comes just days after a gunman opened fire at a Pittsburgh synagogue, killing 11 people and wounding six others.

In response, the ADL has called on Congress to do more to combat antisemitism.

"We call on Congress to take action by passing legislation to explicitly identify and combat this rising hate, and by passing a federal law that would make it a crime to target vulnerable communities for their religious beliefs," Greenblatt said.

The ADL's report is based on data from law enforcement agencies, religious groups, and other groups.

title: Ex - MLB star Steve Garvey calls on Soros - backed DA to prosecute LA synagogue attackers :  Unconscionable
message:

And I will challenge the LA District Attorney George Gascon to prosecute these people to the full extent of the law."
